laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated extensive aortic root dissection, extending from the sinutubular junction to the brachiocephalic trunk, sparing the coronary sinuses and arch branches.
Showed dilatation of the proximal aorta with a luminal flap; cardiac structure and function were otherwise normal.
Showed cystic medionecrosis of the aortic tissue.
Demonstrated the rest of the aorta to be of normal size, but showed diffuse arterial elongations and tortuosities, most apparent in the carotid, vertebral, and basilar territories.
